options.text: Power Platform Landing Zones will deploy and configure the foundation for your Power Platform tenant including all best practices and recommendations from Microsoft, and create the initial landing zones for citizen- and professional developers. The deployment requires that the user is a Global Admin or Power Platform Admin in the Azure Active Directory.

elements.name: spn
elements.label: Existing User Managed Identity Configuration

options.text: The setup requires an existing User Assigned Identity that has been granted RBAC to the Power Platform to complete the deployment.

elements.name: ppIdentity
elements.label: Select an existing User Assigned Identity with permissions to the Power Platform APIs

elements.name: sub
elements.label: Azure subscription

options.text: The setup requires an existing Azure subscription to provision the required infrastructure and components, both in Azure and in Power Platform. Select a subscription and a region where the deployment should be placed, and also specify if you want to use this subscription for all Azure services and required configuration.

elements.name: subscriptionId
elements.label: Subscription
elements.toolTip: Select the Subscription for the deployment.

elements.name: locationName
elements.label: Location
elements.toolTip: Select the Location for the deployment.

elements.name: subOption
elements.label: Use this subscription for all Azure services and configuration
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, the setup will configure this setting.

options.text: Configure tenant security settings and Data-loss prevention policies for Power Platform to meet your overall security requirements. These settings will apply to all existing and new environments in your tenant, and additional restrictions can be configured later in the deployment experience.

elements.name: dlpTenant
elements.label: Tenant Data-loss prevention policy

options.text: Configure overall Data-loss prevention policy for the tenant. This policy will by default apply to all existing and new environments. Additional policies can be configured in the 'Landing Zones' tab.

elements.name: ppTenantDlp
elements.label: Assign recommended Data-loss prevention policies to the tenant by selecting the preferred starting baseline.
elements.toolTip: By select a tenant DLP policy, all existing and new Environments will be governed regarding what connectors can be used, and used together.

allowedValues.label: High
allowedValues.description: A highly restrictive tenant DLP policy that only allows certain Microsoft connectors in the business group. All other connectors are categorized as non-business.

allowedValues.label: Medium
allowedValues.description: A medium restrictive tenant DLP policy that allows common Microsoft connectors in the business group. All other connectors are categorized as non-business.

allowedValues.label: Low
allowedValues.description: A low restrictive tenant DLP policy that allows most Microsoft connectors in the business group. All other connectors are categorized as non-business.

allowedValues.label: None
allowedValues.description: Do not assign tenant DLP policy.

elements.name: tenantIsolationSetting
elements.label: Tenant isolation (preview)

options.text: Configure tenant isolation to block external tenants from establishing connections into your tenant (inbound isolation) as well as block your tenant from establishing connections to external tenants (outbound isolation).

elements.name: ppTenantIsolationSetting
elements.label: Enable tenant isolation
elements.toolTip: Select the preferred tenant isolation method by selecting either inbound, outbound, or both.

elements.name: ppTenantIsolationDomains
elements.label: Explicit allow list (enter Tenant Domain, ID, or * for all tenants)
elements.toolTip: Use only allowed characters

elements.name: tenantGuestsAndSharing
elements.label: Tenant Guest user and sharing settings

options.text: Configure tenant guest and sharing options.

elements.name: ppGuestMakerSetting
elements.label: Prevent Azure AD guests accounts to make Power Apps
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, the setup will configure this setting.

elements.name: ppAppSharingSetting
elements.label: Restrict sharing of PowerApps with the entire organization
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, the setup will configure this setting.

options.text: It is highly recommended to have dedicated Admin Environments in Power Platform to manage and administer the platform as you scale. When creating dedicated Admin Environments, you can optionally deploy the 'Center of Excellence Starter-Kit' post deployement which provides additional capabilities to scale, manage, and operate your Power Platform tenant. The setup creates dedicated Admin Environments for Development, Test, and Production in order to support maintenance, testing, development, and validation before deploying to production.

link.label: Learn more about Center of Excellence Starter-kit

elements.name: tenantEnv
elements.label: Tenant Environment settings

options.text: Configure the overall Environment settings for the tenant. These settings will allow you to control Environment creation process, and capacity management.

elements.name: ppEnvCreationSetting
elements.label: Restrict production and sandbox Environment creation to specific Admins
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, the setup will configure this setting.

elements.name: ppTrialEnvCreationSetting
elements.label: Restrict trial Environment creation to specific Admins
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, the setup will configure this setting

elements.name: ppEnvCapacitySetting
elements.label: Restrict capacity allocation to specific Admins
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, the setup will configure this option.

elements.name: adminEnv
elements.label: Admin Environment configuration

options.text: Create new dedicated Admin Environments that should be used to operate and manage the overall Power Platform tenant, such as Environment creation, DLP management, Identity and Access, and analytics.

elements.name: ppAdminEnvNaming
elements.label: Provide naming convention for the Admin environments
elements.toolTip: Use only allowed characters

constraints.validationMessage: Only alphanumeric characters are allowed, and the value must be 1-30 characters long.

elements.name: ppAdminRegion
elements.label: Select region for the new Admin Environments

elements.name: ppAdminBilling
elements.label: Create Billing Policy and Use Azure Subscription for pay-as-you-go for the environments
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, the setup will configure this option.

elements.name: ppAdminDlp
elements.label: Assign recommended Data-loss prevention policies to the Admin Environments
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, the setup will enable this

options.text: Enabling Managed Environment in this step will opt-in to weekly digest, and allow you to continue the configuration in Power Platform Admin Center for sharing restrictions, DLPs and more post deployment.

elements.name: ppAdminManagedEnv
elements.label: Enable Managed Environments (Preview) for the Admin Environments
elements.toolTip: Managed Environments is a suite of capabilities that allows admins to manage Power Platform at scale with more control, less effort, and more insights

options.text: Configure management and monitoring services for your Power Platform tenant, using recommended Azure services.

elements.name: logging
elements.label: Tenant observability, security, and logging

options.text: Configure critical security and observability options for the Power Platform tenant. These options requires an Azure subscription and Azure services.

elements.name: ppEnableAzureMonitor
elements.label: Enable recommended observability and security integration using Azure services

elements.name: ppRetentionInDays
elements.label: Log Analytics Data Retention (days)
elements.toolTip: Select retention days for Azure logs. Default is 30 days.

elements.name: azMonSection
elements.label: Azure Monitor setup

options.text: Configure Azure Monitor solutions that will be integrated to enhance the security posture of your Power Platform tenant.

elements.name: ppEnable365Compliance
elements.label: Enable auditing and integration with M365 Security & Compliance Center
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, the setup will configure this option.

elements.name: ppEnableAadLogs
elements.label: Enable Monitoring of Azure AD logs

elements.name: ppEnableAzureSecurity
elements.label: Enable integration with Microsoft Sentinel

elements.name: ppEnableD365Connector
elements.label: Enable Sentinel Data Connector for Dynamics 365

elements.name: ppEnableAppInsights
elements.label: Enable integration with Azure Application Insights

elements.name: analytics
elements.label: Tenant analytics and usage

options.text: Configure tenant level analytics to track all-up usage and adoption within the organization across all Environments for Power Apps and Power Automate. For long-term retention, extensibility and richer analysis, you can create a Data Lake Sorage V2 into an Azure subscription and configure Data Export post deployment.

elements.name: ppEnableTenantAnalytics
elements.label: Enable Tenant level analytics for Power Platform

elements.name: ppEnableDataLake
elements.label: Enable Data Lake Storage V2 to store captured data for operational and exploratory analytics

options.text: Prepare and create Landing Zones (Environments for business apps, industry solutions, and professional apps) in Power Platform optimized for citizen developers, professional developers, and industry solutions. When creating these environments, the setup will instantiate dedicated Environments for Development, Test, and Production in order to support maintenance, testing, development, and validation before deploying to production. Lastly, recommended Data-loss prevention policies are provided to further govern the various scenarios.

elements.name: default
elements.label: Default environment

options.text: The Default Environment is available for all users with a license. It is recommended to rename this Environment to clarify the intent of it, such as 'Personal Productivity', and add further restrictions using Data-lose prevention policies scoped to the Default Environment

elements.name: ppDefaultRename
elements.label: Rename the default environment
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, the setup will rename the environment

elements.name: ppDefaultRenameText
elements.label: Provide a new name for the default environment
elements.toolTip: Use only allowed characters

constraints.validationMessage: Only alphanumeric characters are allowed, and the value must be 1-30 characters long.

elements.name: ppDefaultDlp
elements.label: Assign recommended Data-loss prevention policies to the Default Environment
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, the setup will enable this

options.text: Enabling Managed Environment in this step will opt-in to weekly digest, and allow you to continue the configuration in Power Platform Admin Center for sharing restrictions, DLPs and more post deployment.

elements.name: ppDefaultManagedEnv
elements.label: Enable Managed Environments (Preview) for the Default Environment
elements.toolTip: Managed Environments is a suite of capabilities that allows admins to manage Power Platform at scale with more control, less effort, and more insights

elements.name: ppDefaultManagedSharing
elements.label: Exclude sharing with security groups
elements.toolTip: Help reduce risk by limiting how widely canvas apps can be shared.

elements.name: citizenSection
elements.label: Landing Zones for citizen developers

options.text: The Landing Zones for citizen developrs will be optimized for no code/low code scenarios, and provide them with the required agility and simplicity to rapidly build modern business applications. You can grant business units or indivuduals access to the Environments post creation.

elements.name: ppCitizen
elements.label: Create Environments for citizen developer scenarios
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, the setup will create new environments for citizen developer scenarios

allowedValues.label: Yes, and let me configure each Environment

elements.name: ppCitizenConfiguration
elements.label: Citizen Environment configuration

validations.message: Only alphanumeric characters are allowed, and the value must be 1-30 characters long.
Only alphanumeric characters are allowed, and the value must be 1-30 characters long.

elements.name: ppCitizenCount
elements.label: Number of Environments for citizen developers to be created
elements.toolTip: Select how many Environments you will create for citizen developers.

elements.name: ppCitizenNaming
elements.label: Provide naming convention for the citizen developers environments
elements.toolTip: Use only allowed characters

constraints.validationMessage: Only alphanumeric characters are allowed, and the value must be 1-30 characters long.

elements.name: ppCitizenDescription
elements.label: Provide a description for the citizen developers environments
elements.toolTip: Provide general description for these Environments

elements.name: ppCitizenRegion
elements.label: Select region for the new Environments for citizen developers

elements.name: ppCitizenLanguage
elements.label: Select language for the new Environments for citizen developers

elements.name: ppCitizenCurrency
elements.label: Select currency for the new Environments for professional developers

elements.name: ppCitizenDlp
elements.label: Assign recommended Data-loss prevention policies to the Environments for citizen development
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, the setup will enable this

options.text: Enabling Managed Environment in this step will opt-in to weekly digest, and allow you to continue the configuration in Power Platform Admin Center for sharing restrictions, DLPs and more post deployment.

elements.name: ppCitizenManagedEnv
elements.label: Enable Managed Environments (Preview) for the Environments for citizen development
elements.toolTip: Managed Environments is a suite of capabilities that allows admins to manage Power Platform at scale with more control, less effort, and more insights

elements.name: ppCitizenAlm
elements.label: Create Development, Test, and Production environments for each landing zone
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, the setup adhere to best practices and create dedicated environments for sustainable application life-cycle management

elements.name: ppCitizenBilling
elements.label: Create Billing Policy and Use Azure Subscription for pay-as-you-go for the citizen developer Environments
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, the setup will enable it

elements.name: proSection
elements.label: Landing Zones for professional developers

options.text: The Landing Zones for professional developers will be optimized for enterprise application scenarios, and provide them with the required agility and simplicity to rapidly build robust enterprise applications with mature application lifecycle management. You can grant business units or indivuduals access to the Environments post creation.

elements.name: ppPro
elements.label: Create Environments for professional developer scenarios
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, the setup will create new environments for professional developer scenarios

allowedValues.label: Yes, and let me configure each Environment

elements.name: ppProConfiguration
elements.label: Professional Environment configuration

validations.message: Only alphanumeric characters are allowed, and the value must be 1-30 characters long.
Only alphanumeric characters are allowed, and the value must be 1-30 characters long.

elements.name: ppProCount
elements.label: Number of Environments for professional developers to be created
elements.toolTip: Select how many Environments you will create for professional developers.

elements.name: ppProNaming
elements.label: Provide naming convention for the professional developers environments
elements.toolTip: Use only allowed characters

constraints.validationMessage: Only alphanumeric characters are allowed, and the value must be 1-30 characters long.

elements.name: ppProDescription
elements.label: Provide a description for the professional developers environments
elements.toolTip: Provide general description for these Environments

elements.name: ppProRegion
elements.label: Select region for the new Environments for professional developers

elements.name: ppProLanguage
elements.label: Select language for the new Environments for professional developers

elements.name: ppProCurrency
elements.label: Select currency for the new Environments for professional developers

elements.name: ppProDlp
elements.label: Assign recommended Data-loss prevention policies to the Environments for professional development
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, the setup will enable this

options.text: Enabling Managed Environment in this step will opt-in to weekly digest, and allow you to continue the configuration in Power Platform Admin Center for sharing restrictions, DLPs and more post deployment.

elements.name: ppProManagedEnv
elements.label: Enable Managed Environments (Preview) for the Environments for professional development
elements.toolTip: Managed Environments is a suite of capabilities that allows admins to manage Power Platform at scale with more control, less effort, and more insights

elements.name: ppProAlm
elements.label: Create Development, Test, and Production environments for each landing zone
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, the setup will enable it, and adhere to best practices and create dedicated environments for sustainable application life-cycle management

elements.name: ppProBilling
elements.label: Create Billing Policy and Use Azure Subscription for pay-as-you-go for the professional developer Environments
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, the setup will enable it

elements.name: industrySection
elements.label: Landing Zones for Industry Clouds

options.text: The Landing Zones for Industry Clouds are intended to host your D365 applications and Industry Solutions. Once created, you can add the Industry Clouds using 'Microsoft Cloud Solution Center'

elements.name: ppIndustry
elements.label: Create Environments for Industry Clouds
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, the setup will create new environments for Industry scenarios (requires Dataverse)

elements.name: ppSelectIndustry
elements.label: Select Microsoft Cloud for Industry

elements.name: ppIndustryNaming
elements.label: Provide naming convention for the industry environments
elements.toolTip: Use only allowed characters

constraints.validationMessage: Only alphanumeric characters are allowed, and the value must be 1-30 characters long.

elements.name: ppIndustryRegion
elements.label: Select region for the new Environments for the industry clouds

options.text: Enabling Managed Environment in this step will opt-in to weekly digest, and allow you to continue the configuration in Power Platform Admin Center for sharing restrictions, DLPs and more post deployment.

elements.name: ppIndustryManagedEnv
elements.label: Enable Managed Environments (Preview) for the Environments for industry cloud
elements.toolTip: Managed Environments is a suite of capabilities that allows admins to manage Power Platform at scale with more control, less effort, and more insights

elements.name: ppIndustryAlm
elements.label: Create Development, Test, and Production environments for each landing zone
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, the setup will enable it

elements.name: ppIndustryBilling
elements.label: Create Billing Policy and Use Azure Subscription for pay-as-you-go for the Industry Environments
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, the setup will enable it
